result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah E. Mayberry

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Sarah E. Mayberry. Defendant Sarah E. Mayberry in court. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Johnson advises that he is looking into treatment court and needs to talk with the state regarding that.
Status conference scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court with Defendant Sarah E. Mayberry. Clerk: PU
  Minutes:    Case is trailing 22CF961 and bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:55 PM   Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Not Guilty Plea previously entered. Further proceedings scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.. Cash bond posted and continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). rb
at the request of Atty S. Johnson due to DE being ill, FP rescheduled from 07-27 to 08-04-22 at 1pm Intake. DA notified.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court by zoom and w/ Attorney Johnson who appears by zoom.  Clerk. M.Burke. trails new case to 07/27/22 at 1:00 in intake.

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney S. Johnson.  Clerk. M.Burke. Atty Johnson states that they are still in negotiations with the state but are very close to a resolution. PTC set to 07/21/22 at 2:30.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney S. Johnson.   Clerk. M.Burke. Atty Johnson states he needs to be appointed on the 22CM306 case. STC set to 06/30/22 at 9:00. Bond cont.
filed by Atty. Seth Johnson  kmk

records.addlTxt: Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney S Johnson. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Johnson states he just met w/deft for the first time today, has requested discovery; needs time to meet w/client and negotiate w/State. STC continued to 4/27/22 at 9:30am. Bond continued.
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.

01:49 PM    State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 10:00 am with other case 20CM590.  $400  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  ts
